properties.Name: Four Corners Resident Bear
properties.About: After succumbing to rot in 2011, a 120 year-old red oak in Shorewood Hills' Four Corners Park was carved into a sculpture representing Wisconsin's native animals by Jamie Doeren. The sculpture was comissioned by the Village of Shorewood Hills following disagreement in the community over turning the tree into firewood.

properties.Name: Untitled
properties.About: Is it a bird? Is it an island? Is it an amoeba? We have no idea! Decide for yourself when you visit Shorewood Village Hall.

properties.Name: Shift
properties.About: A series of steel panels perforated with patterns is attached to the concrete walls of the Highland Avenue underpass. LED fixtures behind the panels illuminate the previously dark underpass at night with a fantastic light display.

properties.Name: Visible Bucky
properties.About: As part of the "Bucky on Parade" public art event, 85 Bucky Badger statues by different artists were unveiled across Madison. This one is painted with Bucky's muscles and internal organs visible through his clothing, skin, and fur, and originally was displayed in front of Science Hall before being moved to its current location on the corner of Old University and Highland Avenues.

properties.Name: Rachel in Mourning
properties.About: Donated by the Knights of Columbus Catholic fraternal organization in memory of the victims of abortion in 2002. The sculpture faces a gravestone for the victims that was dedicated in October 1995.

properties.Name: Untitled
properties.About: A statue of an angel sitting with a bouquet of flowers in her hands.

properties.Name: Joseph Our Patron
properties.About: A statue of Saint Joseph, holding a hammer and carpenter's square, stands overlooking Resurrection Cemetery.

properties.Name: Memorial to the Unborn Child II
properties.About: A statue of a mother and father weeping before their unborn child, rendered in glass. The statue sits atop a granite columbarium pedestal where the remains of cremated unborn children are put in niches. A memorial brick walkway surrounds the statue.

properties.Name: Fratres Ordinis
properties.About: Fratres Ordinis... Latin for "Brothers of the Order"... perhaps as in keeping order as he watches over the cemetery ghouls each night?

properties.Name: Our Lady Queen of Peace
properties.About: She watches over the parking lot of the Our Lady Queen of Peace Church, keeping the peace and deterring any malevolent forces.

properties.Name: Untitled
properties.About: A metal fish(?) sculpture can be found outside the Wingra Boathouse. It looks like it could be a piece by the late Wisconsin sculptor Dr Evermor.

properties.Name: Anchorlily 2
properties.About: A simple but elegant sculpture of a lilypad with an anchor for its roots welcomes visitors to Wingra Park. The sculpture was installed in 2018 along with the new park entrance.

properties.Name: Jesus and the Children
properties.About: Was installed sometime around or before 1965.

properties.Name: The Rock
properties.About: Unearthed in 1975, "The Rock" has gone on to become an outlet for Edgewood High School students, who paint messages on it for school events.

properties.Name: Sacred Heart of Jesus Grotto
properties.About: Tucked behind Edgewood High School, this grotto features an impressive rock garden that radiates out from the statue's alcove.

properties.Name: Old Woman in a Shoe Slide
properties.About: The slide, located on the playground at Vilas Park, has had many different appearances over the years, with the Madison Metropolitan School District and the Madison Art Museum's Art Cart program for children joining forces to repaint the exterior of the shoe.

properties.Name: Annie C. Stewart Fountain
properties.About: The fountain took seven years to build, and did not function as a fountain for much time after it was completed in 1925. It is known for its deteriorated state, with parts of the sculpture broken off and indiscernable. In 2016, the City of Madison began the process of refurbishing the fountain. When complete it will not function as a fountain. As of 2022, the project is still incomplete.

properties.Name: The Badger
properties.About: The sculpture was installed after the death of its artist, Ho-Chunk sculptor Harry Whitehorse.

properties.Name: St. Joseph
properties.About: The statue is located in the Sisters' Garden behind St. Mary's Hospital. St. Joseph was a favorite saint of Mother Odilia, the foundress of the order that built the hospital.

properties.Name: Untitled
properties.About: The sculpture was installed at the Jess Bullen Memorial Garden in memory of a 29 year-old car crash victim. The turtle sculptures refers to Jess's fondness of turtles.

properties.Name: Madison Gateway
properties.About: A large metal "M" stands at the border between Madison and Monona.

properties.Name: Untitled
properties.About: A seemingly abandoned or forgotten fountain or bird bath sits by the front wall of Olin-Turville Park.

properties.Name: Untitled
properties.About: A brick bench erected in honor of William Davison Stovall, M.D. Signs for businesses have been placed on top of the bench, making it rather unsightly.

properties.Name: Fighting Wisconsin Badger
properties.About: The statue was a gift from the National W Club in honor of the alumni athletic winners at the University of Wisconsin.

properties.Name: The Ripple Effect
properties.About: The sculpture marks the entrance to the Goodman Pool. It features bars of metal in a pattern that illustrates the rippling effect that can be found in water.

properties.Name: Underflow
properties.About: A metal sculpture in a fountain in front of Madison Water Utility.

properties.Name: Alexa
properties.Material: Metal, cast iron, enamel paint, concrete
properties.About:
Local artist Susan Walsh states that the figure represents a worker. Its
 brightly colored parts of cast iron, steel aluminum, and enamel are 
giant replicas of "found" objects which might have come from the 19th 
century manufacturing firms across the street--a wire whisk, rotary 
disks, and a giant candlestick holder as a base. Walsh says Alexa might 
be the feminine for Alexander, a name suggesting power.

properties.Name: Taking Flight
properties.About: This sculpture symbolizes a bird taking flight into the world

properties.Name: Willy Street Park
properties.About: Metal flower

properties.Name: Chinese Fu Dog Lantern
properties.About: Lofty cast concrete octagonal column supports a Chinese lantern, upon which resides the form of a Fu Dog.

properties.Name: Tall White Lantern
properties.About: Eight-sided hollow lantern of cast concrete, exhibiting sixteen rectangular windows, elevated by an octagonal column and topped by an octagonal lid. The entire work is painted white.

properties.Name: Geometric Abstraction
properties.About: Towering geometric abstraction of cast concrete positioned on a square base of the same material. The focal point of the sculpture is a round window that contains caulk and mortar vestiges, which suggest that perhaps a round piece of glass, or a similar material, once resided there.

properties.Name: Blue Lantern on Tripod
properties.About: Towering lantern painted blue, having, as its main component, a large hollow circular form with four holes, topped with a multi-sided lid from which protrudes a fanciful shape culminating in a ball.

properties.Name: Creature Abstract Head
properties.About: Cast concrete whitewashed head and torso mounted upon two cement blocks. The head is of an inverted teardrop in profile with a circular hole through the upper area, acting as the eyes of the figure, and a carved out rectangle to symbolize the mouth. THe torso with its left arm on the hip, is not in profile, giving the work a contorted look.

properties.Name: Blue Urn With Dragon
properties.About:
Large cast concrete urn painted blue with an oriental style dragon in 
red wrapped around it. A blue and red flower resides at the top acting 
as a lid.

properties.Name: Smiling Mushroom
properties.About: Large mushroom-shaped form resembling the face of a frog, having a pink stem, yellow face, and open red mouth complete with white teeth. The form is situated on a square of concrete base along with three small mushrooms, painted white.

properties.Name: Polar Bear Chair
properties.About: Polar bear situated in a seated position, painted white with highlights in red and black. The piece is a functioning chair.

properties.Name: Easter Island Sculpture
properties.About: Cast concrete imposing geometrically stylized human figure with generalized facial features and block-like body embracing a tablet on a shaft. The work was originally painted gold or copper.

properties.Name: Mushrooms
properties.About: Small cast concrete mushrooms of differing heights, presented as a group

properties.Name: Dignified Figure with Tablet
properties.About: Cast concrete imposing geometrically stylized human figure with generalized facial features and block-like body embracing a tablet on a shaft. The work was originally painted gold or copper.

properties.Name: Layered Pyramid
properties.About:
Cast concrete pagoda, painted white, consisting of many squares with 
slanted edges, decreasing in size from the base to the pyramidal point. 
Hollos slots formed by concrete risers, adding the the pyramidal effect,
 separate the squares.

properties.Name: Tree Limb Faces
properties.About: Distorted, elongated faces and bodies form twisting, branch-like forms, culminating in a phallic construction, topped by an orange monarch butterfly.

properties.Name: Let the Great Spirits Soar (Effigy Tree)
properties.About:
From a storm damaged Hackberry tree, / Honors his Indian Ancestors / and
 is a tribute to the effigy mound builders / sculpture funded by the 
City of Madison committee for the arts / Dane County Cultural Affairs 
Commission / and neighbors / Dedicated 5-19-91

properties.Name: Sunbathers
properties.About: This sculpture is three pieces working symbolically with each other. They are made of cut fractured limestone. The shape of each unit resembles abstract human bust forms. Both sides are carved with with the image of a reclining sunbather facing the lake. Installed on June 1, 1993.

properties.Name: MG&E Solar Flower
properties.About: This Sculpture also generate electricity

properties.Name: Untitled
properties.About: The sculpture is composed of two inter-connected limestone cylindrical stone forms. One side of each of the forms is faceted and the surfaces are incised with roughly parallel lines. The composite form sites at an angle on a smooth limestone rectangle and is held up with a rectangular Cot-Ten steel base.

properties.Name: Spring
properties.About: Custom made cast bronze sculpture of a tulip leaf design.

properties.Name: Bronze Hosta Leaf
properties.About: Custom made cast bronze sculpture of hosta leaf design

properties.Name: Bud Forms
properties.About: Given in memory of the artist by her children

properties.Name: Stone Elephants
properties.About: Two custom made, hand carved elephants from Thailand.

properties.Name: Bronze Elephant
properties.About: This Bronze Elephant symbolizes the special relationship between the University of Wisconsin-Madison, the City of Madison, and the UW Alumni in Thailand. Cast in Thailand for the Wisconsin Alumni Association-Thailand. Dedicated by Her Royal Highness Princess Maha Chakri Sirindhorn to Olbrich Botanical Gardens, 1/26/2007 Chitrlada Palace, Bangkok, Thailand.

properties.Name: Stone Lions
properties.About: Two custom made, hand carved lions from Thailand.

properties.Name: Stone Sundial
properties.About: Prairie-styled stone and bronze sundial with hand-carved native limestone top and bronze pointer. Bronze base mounted on concrete footing. Custom design and fabrication.

properties.Name: Fiddleheads
properties.About: Custom made, hand carved limestone sculpture of fiddlehead fern design. The sculpture depicts emerging ferns in the spring. There are five individual fernheads of height varying from four to twelve feet. Although they radiate from a central core at the base, they curve up and out from each other. Each fernhead has detailed carving on the topmost curving portion, which represents the coiled fernhead which has yet to open.

properties.Name: Hippopotamus
properties.About: Life sized, elongated hippo head of cast concrete painted pink, resting on the ground.

properties.Name: Holstein Parade
properties.About: This sculpture was created as part of the Cow Parade event in Wisconsin, 2006

properties.Name: Cow
properties.About: This sculpture was created as part of the Cow Parade event in Wisconsin, 2006

properties.Name: Butterflies
properties.About: Seven metal butterflies stand around the corner of Johnson and East Washington

properties.Name: Dreamkeepers
properties.About: Two large metal birds make out of scrap metal

properties.Name: Cafe Coda
properties.About: Six foot tall abstract sculpture stands in front of Cafe Coda on Willy St

properties.Name: Children on a Rock
properties.About: Located behind the Willy St Co-op. Dedicated to the enjoyment of the Wil-Mar neighborhood by Sandra and Robert Cornelius

properties.Name: Two Figures
properties.About: Two abstract figures stand along the Capitol CIty Trail

properties.Name: We Our Us
properties.About: The words 'We' 'Our' 'Now' are placed along Johnson street

properties.Name: Caltrops
properties.About: This row of metal spikes are found in the perennial garden

properties.Name: Multicolored Pagoda
properties.About: The small sculpture is located infront of Madison Kipp Corp on Waubesa St.

properties.Name: Old Tractor
properties.About: The body of an old tractor sits along the Capitol City Trail

properties.Name: Scrap Sculpture
properties.About: Six foot tall abstract sculpture

properties.Name: Gold Star Mothers Memorial
properties.About: The memorial sculpture was originally located at the Wisconsin General Hospital before being relocated to the Centennial Garden in 1989. It is known for citing the incorrect date of the soldier's death it commemorates (though it is only off by one day).

properties.Name: Untitled
properties.About: A number of small stone humanoid sculptures can be found at the Centennial Garden.

properties.Name: William Dempster Hoard
properties.About: This sculpture was made by the same artist who carved Mount Rushmore in South Dakota. It commemorates William Dempster Hoard, often considered the father of the Wisconsin dairy industry.

properties.Name: Genetics Bio Center "Signs"
properties.About: The two sculptures function as a "sign" for the Genetics Bio Center, by indicating the type of work done there. A photo of a protein is etched into their glass lenses.

properties.Name: Untitled
properties.About: A bisected pyramid sculpture sits at a distance afront the Engineering Building.

properties.Name: The Descendant's Fountain (a.k.a. Maquina)
properties.About: The fountain (named Maquina or "machine" in Spanish) is programmable by engineering students. There are sensors around the fountain that, when activated by human motion, cause the fountain to spray water.

properties.Name: Untitled
properties.About: An abstract red sculpture can be found tucked around the side of the Engineering Building.

properties.Name: Camp Randall Memorial Arch
properties.About: The massive memorial arch honors the troops who trained at Camp Randall during the Civil War. It is flanked by two soldier statues, titled "Young Boy Sentry" and "Old Abe". At the top of the arch is the bald eagle mascot, "Old Abe".

properties.Name: Wave
properties.About: The sculpture outside Chamberlain Hall creates an illusion of motion with its perpetual wave structure.

properties.Name: Essence: The Seed, the Flower, the Fruit
properties.About: A three-part sculpture that illustrates the various stages of life of a plant.

properties.Name: Grace
properties.About: The sculpture brings to mind an abstract dancer. It is located outside of the XO1 Apartment Building.

properties.Name: Abraham Lincoln
properties.About: The infamous statue atop Bascom Hill is a replica of one at Lincoln's birthplace in Kentucky. Lincoln signed the Morrill Act, that sought to give land to states so that they could develop public universities.

properties.Name: Graduation Bucky
properties.About: As part of the "Bucky on Parade" public art event in 2018, "Graduation Bucky" was unveiled. The sculpture can still be found atop Bascom Hill.

properties.Name: Untitled
properties.About: A geode-esque sculpture guards the entrance to Chadbourne Hall.

properties.Name: Mother and Child
properties.About: Purchased in 1977 to show off the new Elvehjem Art Museum (now the Chazen). The mother and child meld into one in a display of intimacy.

properties.Name: Awakening
properties.About: The bronze crescents appear to grow out of the garden bed they are planted in. The artist taught at UW-Madison from 1970 to 2004.

properties.Name: Ancient Fishing
properties.About: A large skull propped upon a crate, this sculpture might fool the viewer into thinking it is made of wood, but it is in fact cast in bronze coated with patina. We think "Skullpture" would have of been a better name for the piece.

properties.Name: Both / And - Tolerance / Innovation
properties.About: Like ancient dolmens, this sculpture stands tall in Library Mall and incorporates light, both natural and artificial, into its presentation. There are sitting spaces surrounding the sculpture.

properties.Name: Well Red
properties.About: Bucky Badger sits in a thoughtful position as he overlooks the terrace at Memorial Union.

properties.Name: Retro Bucky
properties.About: As part of the "Bucky on Parade" public art event in 2018, "Retro Bucky" exemplifies the classic Bucky Badger mascot and stands overlooking Lake Mendota at the Memorial Union.

properties.Name: Hear No Evil, Speak No Evil, and See No Evil
properties.About: The three monkeys sit on a bench outside of the State Street Brats tavern.

properties.Name: Basis
properties.About: Though made of concrete, this sculpture looks like an unfurling flower. The sculpture incorporates seating into its design.

properties.Name: Untitled
properties.About: These 17-foot tall light sculptures illuminate the Kohl Center in ever-changing combinations of color.

properties.Name: Untitled
properties.About: Two segments of chainlink are magnified in size. The sculpture adorns the entrance to the Art Lofts.

properties.Name: The Spirit of Greenbush
properties.About: A memorial to the Greenbush, a working class neighborhood heavily populated by Italian immigrants that was gentrified and redeveloped in the mid 20th-century. Though the Greenbush is demographically different today, this sculpture is a reminder of what once was in one of Madison's most culturally-rich neighborhoods.

properties.Name: Updraft
properties.About: An open arch metal structure that stands over the bike path in Brittingham Park.

properties.Name: Blu³eprint
properties.About: The sculpture portrays its artist seated in a barbershop chair, and honors the experience of black men. The "u" in the title is to the power of three because it reflects the three "u"s in the Zulu word "Ubuntu", referring to the interconnected nature of humanity.

properties.Name: Verex Syzygy
properties.About: A shaft of stainless steel with a point on top rises two stories in front of the Verex Corporation building.

properties.Name: Forward
properties.About: An embodiment of the Wisconsin state motto, "Forward". The statue was replicated in 1996, and in the racial unrest of the summer of 2020 it was vandalized, along with the "Hans Christian Heg" soldier at the other end of Capitol Square.

properties.Name: Roads Diverge
properties.About: An assortment of what look to be street signs but actually contain reference points of a more existential nature stand in Rotary Centennial Plaza outside the Madison Children's Museum.

properties.Name: Justice
properties.About: Outline of a full-length female figure of a blind Justice with her scales held up in her left hand.

properties.Name: Hans Christian Heg
properties.About: A statue of Union soldier and abolitionist Hans Christian Heg. The statue was vandalized and thrown into a lake during the racial unrest of the summer of 2020, along with the "Forward" statue at the other end of Capitol Square. It was restored the following year.

properties.Name: From Local Pastures
properties.About: A cow sculpture is painted with the fruits of local agriculture. Could be a remnant of the 2006 "Cows on Parade" sculpture show.

properties.Name: Timekeeper
properties.About: A series of blue arches are attached to the top of concrete pillars overlooking Lake Monona beside Monona Terrace.

properties.Name: Living for the Dream
properties.About: A memorial to Martin Luther King, Jr. is the namesake for the boulevard it is located on.

properties.Name: Untitled
properties.About: Abstract elongated shapes welcome visitors to the Wisconsin Manufacturers & Commerce building.

properties.Name: Helix Sculpture
properties.About: A kinetic sculpture located in front of the Sonderegger Science Center at Edgewood College. It was erected in honor of Carl G. Meyer, a college trustee who lived from 1902-1982.
